p: Viruses cause respiratory tract infections (RTIs), which if severe, can lead to a visit to the Emergency Department (ED) and hospitalization. This places a large burden on healthcare services in primary and secondary care but also puts patients with chronic lung diseases such as chronic obstructive pulmonary disease (COPD)[ 1] and asthma at risk of an exacerbation[ 2, 3]. During epidemics, viruses can also lead to death as has been demonstrated with influenza, respiratory syncytial virus (RSV) [ 4, 5], particularly in the young and elderly[ 6â€“ 8]. Therefore, identifying viruses and monitoring the severity of their effects will always remain a major scientific and clinical endeavor.
